title: Enhancing Teaching Practical Competencies: Constructivist-Based Self-Directed Social Studies Project Design for Elementary Education

context.prior_knowledge: Core social studies theories and comprehension of elementary education curricula
context.additional_context: Competency enhancement program for professionals in education/teaching/learning fields

learning_goals: Design three types of learning projects based on constructivist principles by analyzing real-world social issues.
Develop five or more social problem-solving activities suitable for elementary learners.

Learners design a three-stage self-directed feedback system (self-assessment, peer review, teacher verification) using digital tools (Google Forms, Padlet) and present a concrete operational manual (including evaluation criteria, cycles, feedback templates) applicable to elementary and secondary school settings.
Create one or more project-based assessment rubrics.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
